endpoints_summary.summary: Retrieve most recent GitOps log for entity

details.description: Note: Dangerous operation that will delete all entities that are of the given type

parameters.description: A list of entity types or IDs delete
parameters.name: types

details.x-cortex-mcp-description: Delete all entities of specific types. If the client is trying to fetch data for teams, use 'type': 'team' in these APIs. Disabled for MCP access due to the destructive nature of bulk operations that could remove critical infrastructure components.

details.description:
List all entities across the Service, Resource and Domain Catalogs.

This API returns summary data for each entity, so refer to the retrieve entity method to lookup more details for a single entity.

parameters.description: Filter based on groups, which correspond to the `x-cortex-groups` field in the Catalog Descriptor. Accepts a comma-delimited list of groups
parameters.name: groups

parameters.description: Filter based on owner group names, which correspond to the `x-cortex-owners` field in the Catalog Descriptor. Accepts a comma-delimited list of owner group names
parameters.name: owners

parameters.description: Depth of the parent / children hierarchy nodes. Can be 'full' or a valid integer
parameters.name: hierarchyDepth

parameters.description: Supports only GitHub repositories in the `org/repo` format
parameters.name: gitRepositories

parameters.description: List of sub fields to include for hierarchies. Only supports 'groups'
parameters.name: includeHierarchyFields

parameters.description: Filter the response to specific types of entities. By default, this includes services, resources, and domains. Corresponds to the `x-cortex-type` field in the entity descriptor.
parameters.name: types

parameters.description: Filter based on a [search query](https://docs.cortex.io/settings/search). This will search across entity properties. If provided, results will be sorted by relevance.
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: Whether to include archived entities in the response
parameters.name: includeArchived

parameters.description: Whether to include custom data for each entity in the response
parameters.name: includeMetadata

parameters.description: Whether to include links for each entity in the response
parameters.name: includeLinks

parameters.description: Whether to include Slack channels for each entity in the response
parameters.name: includeSlackChannels

parameters.description: Whether to include ownership information for each entity in the response
parameters.name: includeOwners

parameters.description: List of sub fields to include for different types
parameters.name: includeNestedFields

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page, between 1 and 1000. Default 250.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Page number to return, 0-indexed. Default 0.
parameters.name: page

details.x-cortex-mcp-description: List and filter catalog entities with support for pagination, search, and various filters including groups, types, owners, and git repositories. If the client is trying to fetch data for teams, use 'type': 'team' in these APIs.

details.description: Gets a list of entities based on type and batch key plus identifier

parameters.description: The type name of the batches to retrieve. This corresponds to the `x-cortex-type` field in the entity descriptor.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The batch key to filter entities by. This is a custom field set as entity metadata `__cortex_batch.key`
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The batch version. This is a custom field set as entity metadata `__cortex_batch.identifier`, required if `compare` is specified
parameters.name: version

parameters.description: The type over comparison to perform. Ignored unless `version` parameter must also be provided.  Values can be `eq`, `ne`.
parameters.name: compare

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page, between 1 and 1000. Default 250.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Page number to return, 0-indexed. Default 0.
parameters.name: page

200.description: List of entity identifiers matching the batch key and type, based on the specified compare parameter.

details.description:
List entity descriptors

The descriptors do not include objects (e.g. custom data, dependencies, etc) defined via the API

parameters.description: When true, returns the YAML representation of the descriptors
parameters.name: yaml

parameters.description: Filter the response to specific types of entities. By default, this includes services, resources, and domains. Corresponds to the `x-cortex-type` field in the entity descriptor.
parameters.name: types

parameters.description: Number of entities to return per page
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Page number to return, 0 indexed
parameters.name: page

details.x-cortex-mcp-description: Cortex Catalog API - Access and manage your service catalog, teams, domains, and resources

parameters.description: The tag (`x-cortex-tag`) or unique, auto-generated identifier for the entity.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

details.x-cortex-mcp-description: Delete an entity from the catalog. This operation is disabled for MCP access due to its destructive nature.

parameters.description: The tag (`x-cortex-tag`) or unique, auto-generated identifier for the entity.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

parameters.description: Depth of the parent / children hierarchy nodes. Can be 'full' or a valid integer
parameters.name: hierarchyDepth

parameters.description: List of sub fields to include for hierarchies. Only supports 'groups'
parameters.name: includeHierarchyFields

parameters.description: Include ownership information, default is true
parameters.name: includeOwners

details.x-cortex-mcp-description: Retrieve comprehensive details about a specific entity including its metadata, ownership, hierarchies, and relationships. This is the primary method for getting complete information about services, teams, or domains.

parameters.description: The tag (`x-cortex-tag`) or unique, auto-generated identifier for the entity.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

details.x-cortex-mcp-description: Archive an entity. Disabled for MCP access to prevent accidental archival of critical services that could impact system visibility

endpoints.summary: Retrieve most recent GitOps log for entity

parameters.description: The tag (`x-cortex-tag`) or unique, auto-generated identifier for the entity.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

200.description: Retrieve most recent GitOps log for entity

details.summary: Retrieve most recent GitOps log for entity

details.description:
Retrieve entity descriptor

The descriptor does not include objects (e.g. custom data, dependencies, etc) defined via the API

parameters.description: When true, returns the YAML representation of the descriptor
parameters.name: yaml

parameters.description: The tag (`x-cortex-tag`) or unique, auto-generated identifier for the entity.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

details.x-cortex-mcp-description: Cortex Catalog API - Access and manage your service catalog, teams, domains, and resources

parameters.description: The tag (`x-cortex-tag`) or unique, auto-generated identifier for the entity.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

parameters.description: The tag (`x-cortex-tag`) or unique, auto-generated identifier for the entity.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

details.x-cortex-mcp-description: Unarchive an entity. Disabled for MCP access to maintain consistent entity lifecycle management

details.description: Creates or updates an entity using OpenAPI. If the YAML refers to an entity that already exists (as referenced by the `x-cortex-tag`), this API will merge the specified changes into the existing entity.

parameters.description: When true, this endpoint only validates the descriptor contents and returns any errors or warnings.
parameters.name: dryRun

parameters.description: Delete keys with this value from the merged yaml, e.g. `__delete__`, if any values match this, they will not be included in merged YAML. For example `my_value: __delete__` will remove `my_value` from the merged YAML.
parameters.name: deleteMarkerValue

parameters.description: Default merge behavior is to replace arrays, set this to true to append arrays instead. For simple types, duplicate values will be removed from the merged array.
parameters.name: appendArrays

parameters.description: Default behavior is to upsert the entity, set `failIfEntityDoesNotExist=true` to fail (404) if the entity specified in `x-cortex-tag` does not exist.
parameters.name: failIfEntityDoesNotExist

requestBody.description:
Raw text of the YAML  
 See examples of cortex.yaml files for each entity type [here](https://docs.cortex.io/docs/reference/basics/entities#example-cortexyaml-for-service-entity)

200.description: Indicates that the entity body was accepted, and the referenced `x-cortex-tag` existed and patched successfully

201.description: Indicates that the entity body was accepted, and the referenced `x-cortex-tag` did not exist and was created successfully

400.description: Invalid YAML (major errors or incorrectly formatted YAML)

404.description: Specified entity does not exist (when failIfDoesNotExist is set to true)

details.description: Create a catalog entity using a descriptor YAML. By default (UPSERT mode), if the entity already exists (as referenced by the `x-cortex-tag`), this API will update the existing entity. In CREATE mode, the API will fail if the entity already exists.

parameters.description: When true, this endpoint only validates the descriptor contents and returns any errors or warnings.
parameters.name: dryRun

parameters.description: Add a comment with validation errors on the pull request with the given ID
parameters.name: githubPullRequest

parameters.description: Mode of operation: UPSERT (default) creates or updates existing entity, CREATE fails if entity already exists.
parameters.name: mode

requestBody.description:
Raw text of the YAML  
 See examples of cortex.yaml files for each entity type [here](https://docs.cortex.io/docs/reference/basics/entities#example-cortexyaml-for-service-entity)

200.description: Indicates that the entity was accepted and processed successfully

400.description: Invalid YAML (major errors or incorrectly formatted YAML)

key.description: The custom data key, referred to in CQL as custom("key")

Metadata.description: Custom data key/values associated with the entity.

children.description: Nested children chain for the specific entity.

parents.description: Nested parent chain for the specific entity.

EntityHierarchyDetails.description: Hierarchy details for the entity. Includes both the parent & the children chains.

description.description: Description of the entity visible in the Service, Resource, or Domain Catalog. Markdown is supported.

groups.description: Corresponds to the x-cortex-groups field in the Catalog Descriptor

items.description: Corresponds to the x-cortex-groups field in the Catalog Descriptor

id.description: Unique, immutable, 18-character auto-generated identifier for the entity.

links.description: Relevant links for the entity. Corresponds to the x-cortex-links field in the entity descriptor

metadata.description: Custom data key/values associated with the entity

tag.description: Unique identifier for the entity. Corresponds to the x-cortex-tag field in the entity descriptor.

type.description: Type of the entity. Corresponds to the x-cortex-type field in the entity descriptor or 'service' for services.

channel.description: The Slack channel identifier without the preceding #

description.description: Description of this owner defined in the Catalog Descriptor. Not to be confused with the description of the team in the Team pages.

inheritance.description: Inheritance type, only defined for domain entities

notificationsEnabled.description: Refers to the corresponding field in the Catalog Descriptor. This is meant to be used for your automation purposes and does not actually impact the notification behavior in Cortex.

SlackChannel.description: Use the top-level `slackChannels` field instead of the one nested inside `ownership`

groups.description: List of IdP or Cortex Teams (not to be confused with the x-cortex-groups).

slackChannels.description: Use the top-level `slackChannels` field instead of the one nested inside `ownership`

description.description: Description of this owner defined in the Catalog Descriptor. Not to be confused with the description of the team in the Team pages.

groupName.description: The slug for the group as defined in the ownership provider. For example, the org/team for GitHub teams or the team tag for Cortex Teams

inheritance.description: Inheritance type, only defined for domain entities

provider.description: If defined, indicates the ownership provider the team slug references

OwnerGroup.description: List of IdP or Cortex Teams (not to be confused with the x-cortex-groups).

groups.description: List of groups for this node. Only included if includeHierarchyFields contains groups

items.description: List of groups for this node. Only included if includeHierarchyFields contains groups

HierarchyParentNode.description: Parent at the current depth, and its parents.

description.description: An optional description of the link

name.description: Human-readable name for the link visible in the Catalog

type.description: Corresponds to the type field in a link definition provided in the Catalog Descriptor

Link.description: Relevant links for the entity. Corresponds to the x-cortex-links field in the entity descriptor

source.description: Source of the role if pulled in through integration. This will be blank if manually defined in Cortex.

ids.description: Unique, immutable, 18-character auto-generated identifier for the entity.

items.description: Unique, immutable, 18-character auto-generated identifier for the entity.

description.description: Description of the entity visible in the Service, Resource, or Domain Catalog. This may contain markdown.

groups.description: Corresponds to the x-cortex-groups field in the Catalog Descriptor

items.description: Corresponds to the x-cortex-groups field in the Catalog Descriptor

id.description: Unique, immutable, 18-character auto-generated identifier for the entity.

links.description: Relevant links for the entity. Corresponds to the x-cortex-links field in the entity descriptor

metadata.description: Custom data key/values associated with the entity.

tag.description: Unique identifier for the entity. Corresponds to the x-cortex-tag field in the entity descriptor.

type.description: Type of the entity. Corresponds to the x-cortex-type field in the entity descriptor or 'service' for services.

number.description: Rank of the level where 1 is the highest

groups.description: List of groups for this node. Only included if includeHierarchyFields contains groups

items.description: List of groups for this node. Only included if includeHierarchyFields contains groups

HierarchyChildNode.description: Child at the current depth, and its children.

alias.description: Custom defined alias (this is only relevant if you have opted into multi account support)

basepath.description: If the entity is in a monorepo (e.g. in a subdirectory), this field defines the subdirectory

repository.description: Repository name as defined in your Git provider

GitDetails.description: Metadata about the entity's git repository

ListCatalogEntities.description: List of all catalog entities, including services, resources, and domains. Use the \"type\" field to determine what type each entity is.

notificationsEnabled.description: Whether notifications are enabled for this channel

description.description: Description of this owner defined in the Catalog Descriptor, not to be confused with the description of the team in the Team pages

inheritance.description: Inheritance type, only defined for domain entities

repositoryName.description: Repository name as defined in your Git provider

id.description: Unique, immutable, 18-character auto-generated identifier for the team entity

inheritance.description: Inheritance type, only defined for domain entities

name.description: Human-readable name for the team entity

provider.description: If defined, indicates the ownership provider the team slug references

tag.description: Unique identifier for the team entity. Corresponds to the x-cortex-tag field in the entity descriptor

dateCreated.description: Date when the GitOps log was created

fileName.description: Relative path of the cortex.yaml file
